intro: Rostraria pumila, commonly known as the small rostraria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts when mature.
